title: Games By Priyanshu
text:
Features

Collection of fun and interactive web-based games
Built using HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Responsive design for seamless gameplay on desktop and mobile devices
Continuous updates with new games and improvements

title: Games By Priyanshu
text:
Available Games

1. Magic Square
Category: Puzzles
A magic square is a grid of numbers where the sum of the numbers in each row, column, and diagonal is the same.


2. Typing Speed Challenge
Category: Challenge
Test your typing speed and accuracy by typing a passage of text as quickly as you can.


3. Connect 4
Category: Puzzles
A two-player game where players take turns dropping colored discs into a 7x6 grid. The objective is to form a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal line of four discs.


4. Minesweeper
Category: Puzzles
Reveal squares on a grid while avoiding hidden mines. Numbers indicate how many mines are adjacent to a revealed square.


5. Advanced Tic-Tac-Toe
Category: Puzzles
A two-player game where players mark a grid (3x3, 4x5, or 5x5) with “X” or “O.” The goal is to get three marks in a row, column, or diagonal.


6. Sliding Puzzle
Category: Puzzles
Slide tiles around on a grid (3x3, 4x4, or larger) to arrange them in numerical or image order.


7. Classic Sudoku Game
Category: Puzzles
A logic-based number placement puzzle. Fill a 9x9 grid so that each row, column, and 3x3 region contains the digits 1-9 without repetition.


8. Word Search Game
Category: Puzzles
Find hidden words in a grid of letters. A fun way to train your brain and puzzle skills!


9. Square Maze
Category: Puzzles
Navigate through a randomly generated maze to reach the exit. Use keyboard controls to guide your way.


10. Latin Square
Category: Puzzles
A Latin Square is a grid where each row and column contains each symbol exactly once


11. N-Queens Puzzle
Category: Puzzles
N-Queens puzzle game where the player needs to place queens on a chess board without them threatening each other.

text:
How to Play
    
        Click on the paragraph and start typing, as you type you would start seeing the focus shifting to the next character.
        You have 60 seconds to type all the sentences you see.

title: N-Queens puzzle
text:
How to Play
        Place N queens on an NxN chess board where no two queens threaten each other.
        
            Click a cell to place or remove a queen
            Queens cannot share the same row, column, or diagonal
            Threatened squares will be highlighted in red
            Place all queens without conflicts to win!
        
    

    
        4x4
        5x5
        6x6
        8x8
        9x9
        10x10
        11x11
        12x12
    

    
    

    
        Get Hint
        Check Solution
        Reset

title: Square Maze
text:
How to Play
        
            Select a maze size from the dropdown menu
            Click "Generate Maze" to create a new maze
            Use arrow keys or WASD to move the player (red square)
            Reach the green end point to win
            Click "Reset Player" to return to start position
            Generate a new maze anytime for a fresh challenge
        
    
    
        
            
                10x10
                20x20
                30X30
                40X40
                50X50
                60X60
                70X70
                80X80
                90X90
            
            Generate Maze
            Reset Player

title: Latin Square Puzzle
text:
How to Play
        Fill in the grid so that each number appears exactly once in each row and column.
        1. Click an empty cell to select it
        2. Click a number from the number pad to fill the cell
        3. Use hints if you get stuck
        4. Complete the grid without any conflicts to win!
    

    
        3x3
        4x4
        5x5
    

    
    

    
        Get Hint
        Check Solution
        Reset

title: Connect 4
text:
How to Play
        
            The game is played between two players: Player 1 and Player 2.
            Each player takes turns choosing one of the 7 columns and drops their disc into it. Player 1 uses red discs, and Player 2 uses yellow discs.
            The discs fall straight down to the next available space in the column.
            The goal is to form a line of four discs of your own color. This line can be horizontal, vertical, or diagonal.
            If all the spaces on the grid are filled and neither player has connected four discs, the game ends in a draw.
        
        Winning the Game
        A player wins by forming a continuous line of four of their discs either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. The first player to do so is declared the winner!
    

    
        
    

    
        
            Difficulty
            
                
                    Level 1
                    Level 2 (Passive)
                    Level 3
                    Level 4 (Easy)
                    Level 5
                    Level 6 (Moderate)
                    Level 7
                    Level 8 (Tougher)
                
            
            Restart game

title: About
text:
I’m Muthukrishnan, currently working as an Engineering Manager as Sanas AI Inc. I have over 16 years of experience in building scalable SaaS applications from the ground up. Throughout my career, I’ve had the privilege of working in dynamic environments, from startups to established enterprises, contributing to the growth and success of each. As a hands-on leader, I’ve built and scaled applications that have grown from hundreds of users to millions, and I have filed about five patents. These patents cover a range of technologies, from optical character recognition (OCR) to systems for cross-application walkthroughs and UI element retrieval.
In my previous role at Whatfix, I’m proud to have architected and launched the Desktop business, which now generates over $2 million in revenue. I built the team from scratch, guiding them to deliver innovative solutions that address real-world challenges. In addition to my leadership role, I remain an individual contributor, often running proof of concepts for potential revenue-generating features.
My expertise extends across system design, software architecture, and various programming languages like Java, JavaScript, and Python. I’m deeply committed to process optimization and fostering an agile culture that drives efficiency and quality.
Having been a startup founder myself, I understand the nuances of growing a business, and I’ve played a key role in helping two startups scale from early-stage development to Series A and beyond. This blend of technical know-how and entrepreneurial experience fuels my drive to build products that not only solve problems but also create value for businesses and users alike.
When I’m not working, I enjoy sharing my insights with the world through writing on my blog. You can always reach out to me via LinkedIn, my blog, or GitHub for a conversation about technology, engineering management, or the future of SaaS.

title: Knight’s Tour
text:
How to Play
        Move the knight to visit every square exactly once on the chessboard.
        
            Click highlighted squares to move the knight
            Visit all squares to win
            Try to complete the tour in the shortest time
            Green squares show visited positions
            Yellow squares show possible moves
        
    

    
    
        New Game
        Show Hint

title: Advanced Tic-Tac-Toe
text:
How to Play
    
        The game is played on a 3x3, 4x4 or 5x5 grid.
        Players take turns marking an empty cell with their symbol (X or O).
        The goal is to be the first player to form a straight line of 3,4 or 5 of your symbols.
        The line can be horizontal, vertical, or diagonal.
        If all squares are filled and no player has formed a line of their symbols, the game is a draw.
    


    
        Easy
        Medium
        Hard
    
    
        3x3
        4x4
        5x5
    
    New Game

title: Word Search Game
text:
How to Play
        
            Find words from the list below in the grid of letters
            Words can be placed in any of these directions:
                
                    Horizontally (→)
                    Vertically (↓)
                    Diagonally (↘ or ↗)
                    Backwards in any direction (← ↑ ↙ ↖)
                
            
            Click and drag your mouse over the letters to select a word
            When you find a word, it will be highlighted in green and crossed off the list
            Find all words to win the game!
